image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Missouri; born in San Antonio, Bexar County, Tex., October 16, 1951; attended elementary schools in Wichita, Kans., and in Seville, Spain; graduated from Airline High School, Bossier City, La., 1968; B.A., Grinnell College, Grinnell, Iowa, 1972; economist; legislative aide to county executive, Jackson County, Mo.; elected, Missouri general assembly, 1977-1982; delegate, Missouri State Democratic convention, 1978; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 1995); was not a candidate for reelection in 1994, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Alan Dupree Wheat" in Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2008.

researchRecord.name: 1994, 9 commercials on 3 videoreels and 8 commercials on 7 videocassettes.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Alan Dupree Wheat's campaign for the 1994 U.S. senatorial election in Missouri, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: ca. 1982-1994, 257 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Alan Dupree Wheat consist of congressional files, including press releases, newsletters, correspondence, Member's Individual Voting Records, office files, calendars, speeches, photographs, and videotapes.

recordLocation.name: Western Historical Manuscript Collection - Kansas City
